meanings.definition: The quality of pretending to be more important or intelligent than one actually is.
meanings.sent1: Her constant pretentiousness made it hard to have a genuine conversation with her.
meanings.sent2: His pretentiousness was evident in the way he name-dropped famous people he claimed to know.
meanings.sent3: The pretentiousness of the peacock trying to outshine the other birds was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The pretentiousness of the old mansion was a facade hiding its crumbling interior.
meanings.sent5: The pretentiousness of the chef's dishes left a bitter taste in the diners' mouths.

meanings.definition: Behavior that is intended to impress or show off in a way that is not genuine.
meanings.sent1: The pretentiousness of his flashy car was a clear attempt to impress others.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his pretentiousness and realized he was not as wealthy as he claimed.
meanings.sent3: The pretentiousness of the peacock strutting around the farm drew amused chuckles from the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The pretentiousness of the city lights at night gave the illusion of a grandeur that was not truly there.
meanings.sent5: The pretentiousness of the new student trying to fit in was painfully obvious to everyone.
